content.section: Departments Data - Departments - Training And Placement
content.text: Description: The Department of Training and Placement conducts many Training Programmes to all students to develop their technical knowledge and soft skills in the areas of Aptitude, Logical Reasoning, Quantitative Reasoning and Verbal through the qualified and reputed External Training Centers. Also the training programmes like Mock Interviews, Group Discussions, Oral and Written Communication Skills and Workshop etc. are conducted for final year students by HR Managers from different industries. The Department of Training and Placement plays a vital role in locating job opportunities for Under Graduates and Post Graduates who all are passing out from the college by keeping in touch with top-notch companies and industries. The Department of Training and Placement operates round the year to facilitate interactions between companies and budding graduates. The number of students placed through the campus interviews is continuously trending towards increasing. Based on the invitations, many reputed companies are regularly visiting the institute to conduct campus interviews..

content.section: Research Innovation Data - Tabs - Content - Items
content.text: Serial No: 1. Faculty Name: Dr. Jayasutha.D. Title: Monitoring the Progress of Labour from Remote area using Medical IoT. Duration: One year. Amount: 1,90,000. Amount Utilized: 1,90,000. Outcomes: 1. This system enables timely medical interventions, early detection of complications, and effective remote consultation, reducing maternal and infant mortality rates. 2. The project demonstrates the feasibility and effectiveness of integrating IoT technology into rural healthcare infrastructure, bridging the gap between remote patients and expert medical care. Year: 2023-24.

content.section: Research Innovation Data - Tabs - Content - Items
content.text: Serial No: 2. Faculty Name: Dr. Senthilkumar.R. Title: Robotic Companies in Healthcare: Investigate the Role of Humanoid Robots in Augmenting Patient Well Being. Duration: One year. Amount: 1,75,000. Amount Utilized: 1,75,000. Outcomes: 1. A humanoid robot used in healthcare has enhanced a patient well-being by assisting in rehabilitation, elderly care, and mental health support. 2. The investigation underscores the growing acceptance and integration of humanoid robots in hospitals and home care, demonstrating their potential to complement human caregivers and transform the delivery of patient-centered care. Year: 2023-24.

content.section: Research Innovation Data - Tabs - Content - Items
content.text: Serial No: 1. Faculty Name: Dr. Ramasamy.S. Title: Premature finding and analysis of multi disease from healthcare big data in cloud environment exhausting amalgam deep learning technique. Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,00,000. Amount Utilized: 1,00,000. Outcomes: 1. Analyzed a multi disease from the healthcare big data and produced the accurate result in heart disease. 2. The approach not only reduces diagnosis time but also supports healthcare professionals with actionable insights, contributing to timely interventions and improved patient outcomes across diverse medical conditions.. Year: 2022-23.

content.text: Serial No: 2. Faculty Name: Mrs. Banupriya.M, & Mrs. Rajaprabha.C.E. Title: IoT Based Smart Crop Protection System for Agriculture. Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,90,000. Amount Utilized: 1,90,000. Outcomes: 1. Analyzed a IoT-based smart crop protection system enhances agricultural productivity by enabling real-time pest detection and watering. 2. The system's remote accessibility and scalability make it especially beneficial for small and medium-scale farmers, promoting smarter farming practices and ensuring healthier crop yields.. Year: 2022-23.

content.section: Research Innovation Data - Tabs - Content - Items
content.text: Serial No: 3. Faculty Name: Mrs. Vidhya.D. Title: AI based localization and classification of skin disease with erythema. Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,85,000. Amount Utilized: 1,85,000. Outcomes: Monitored an AI-based system for localization and classification of skin diseases with erythrocyte improves early detection and diagnosis. Year: 2022-23. Serial No: 4. Faculty Name: Mrs. Gnanakumari.R, & Mrs. Saranya.S. Title: Stroke Disease Prediction using Deep learning model CNN and Bidirectional LSTM. Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,50,000. Amount Utilized: 1,50,000. Outcomes: 1. How a deep learning model using CNN and Bi-directional LSTM enhances stroke prediction by extracting spatial and temporal features for accurate risk assessment. 2. This deep learning-based approach enables timely stroke risk assessment, facilitating early intervention and potentially reducing stroke-related mortality and long-term disability.. Year: 2022-23.

content.section: Research Innovation Data - Tabs - Content - Items
content.text: Serial No: 5. Faculty Name: Mr. Murugan.K. Title: IoT Empowered Automated Solar Grass Cutter. Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,50,000. Amount Utilized: 1,50,000. Outcomes: 1. Analyze how an IoT-empowered automated solar grass cutter enhances lawn maintenance by enabling remote monitoring, autonomous operation, and energy-efficient grass cutting. 2. Powered by solar energy, the system ensures sustainable operation without dependency on external power sources.. Year: 2022-23. Serial No: 1. Faculty Name: Senthilkumar.R. Title: Intelligence Support System for Diagnosis of Covid-19 and captioning of X-ray images using LSTM and RNN with explain-ability. Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,40,000. Amount Utilized: 1,40,000. Outcomes: 1. An intelligent support system using LSTM and RNN enhances COVID-19 diagnosis by accurately analyzing and captioning X-ray images with explainability. 2. The model achieved high precision, recall, and F1 score in detecting Covid-19 from X-ray images, validating its potential use as a diagnostic support tool for radiologists and healthcare professionals.. Year: 2021-22.

content.section: Research Innovation Data - Tabs - Content - Items
content.text: Serial No: 2. Faculty Name: Mr. Arun.R. Title: Brain Tumour Detection Using DCNN and its Applications using FPGA implementations. Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,98,000. Amount Utilized: 1,98,000. Outcomes: 1. How a brain tumor detection system using DCNN and FPGA improves diagnostic accuracy by enabling real-time, high-speed image processing with low power consumption. 2. The DCNN model achieved high classification accuracy in detecting and localizing brain tumours from MRI scans, demonstrating its effectiveness in medical image analysis.. Year: 2021-22.

content.section: Research Innovation Data - Tabs - Content - Items
content.text: Serial No: 3. Faculty Name: Subhalakshmi.R.T. Title: Automatic Segmentation and Classification of Covi-19 CT images using dual branch combination network (DCN). Duration: One Year. Amount: 1,95,000. Amount Utilized: 1,95,000. Outcomes: 1. Analyzed how an automatic segmentation and classification system using a Dual Branch Combination Network (DCN) enhances COVID-19 CT image analysis by improving accuracy in lesion detection and classification. 2. The segmentation branch of the network precisely highlighted infection areas in the lungs, helping radiologists to visualize and assess the severity of Covid-19 involvement.. Year: 2021-22.

S  No: 1. Problem  Statement: Smart inventory and logistics management system for MSME in remote location. Students: ADHEEP DAS (720821103006), DHANASEKAR M (720821103018), HARISANKAR A (720821103034), KABILESH R (720821103044). W P  Attributes: WP2, WP5, WP6. Proposed  E A: EA1, EA2, EA3. P O  Mapped: PO1, PO2, PO3, PO6. S D G  Goals: SDG8, SDG9. P S O: PSO2. Justification: The Smart Inventory and Logistics Management System for MSMEs in remote locations requires WP2 as it involves data analysis, numerical methods, and formal aspects of computer science to optimize logistics, manage inventory, and ensure efficient supply chain operations using real-time data. WP5 is relevant as the system promotes efficient resource use and sustainable practices by minimizing waste, reducing operational costs, and supporting eco-friendly logistics, contributing to long-term sustainability. WP6 aligns with the project as it utilizes engineering practice and technology like IoT and AI to create a solution that integrates physical resources and technology, ensuring effective real-time monitoring and decision-making for MSMEs, especially in remote areas where infrastructure is limited.. Course: 20CS710 & Project Work. Source: Niral Thiruvizha. Year: 2024-2025.

S  No: 2. Problem  Statement: AI Enhanced IoT based Waste Management system for real time drainage monitoring and maintenance. Students: AKSHAYA E (720821103009), KAMALESHWARI R (720821103046), KAVIN KUMAR P (720821103053), KAVIYASRI J (720821103054). W P  Attributes: WP2, WP4, WP6. Proposed  E A: EA1, EA3, EA5. P O  Mapped: PO1, PO2, PO4. S D G  Goals: SDG6, SDG11. P S O: PSO2. Justification: WP2 is relevant as the system utilizes data analysis and machine learning algorithms to process real-time data for drainage monitoring and decision-making. WP4 applies because the system integrates IoT and AI technologies, applying engineering principles for smart waste management solutions. WP6 aligns with the real-world application of IoT and AI for waste and drainage management, ensuring the system works effectively in urban environments. EA1 applies as the system uses various resources, including IoT sensors, data, and AI algorithms, to monitor and manage drainage systems. EA3 is relevant because the system uses innovative AI and IoT solutions to address urban waste and drainage challenges.. Course: 20CS710 & Project Work. Source: Niral Thiruvizha. Year: 2024-2025.

WP6 is relevant as the system involves engineering technologies like robotics and automation for the precise dispensing of medication in hospitals. WP7 aligns with addressing the role of engineering in improving healthcare operations and patient safety by automating medication distribution. EA1 is justified because the system integrates IoT devices, AI models, and robotic technologies to automate and improve medication dispensing.. Course: 20CS710 & Project Work. S  No: 6. Problem  Statement: Automated weighment billing system for ration shop with centralized monitoring for enhanced transparency and efficiency. Students: ANBURAJ G (720821103010), ILANTHIRAYAN G (720821103039), KAMALAKANNAN K (720821103045), MOHAMED RIYAZATH ALIE .H (720821103303). W P  Attributes: WP2, WP6, WP7. S  No: 36. Problem  Statement: Real-Time Speech to Sign Animation System with Dynamic Gesture Mapping in Unity 3D. Students: GURUPRASATH A (720821103030), HARISARAN V (720821103035), HARISH KUMAR R (720821103302). W P  Attributes: WP7, WP8, WP9. Proposed  E A: EA1, EA2, EA3. P O  Mapped: PO5, PO6, PO8. S D G  Goals: SDG4, SDG9, SDG10. P S O: PSO2. Justification: WP7 applies as the system addresses the role of engineering in society by enhancing communication for the deaf and hard-of-hearing community, improving accessibility. WP8 is relevant because the system uses cutting-edge research in gesture recognition, speech-to-text conversion, and sign language animation in real time. WP9 aligns with promoting inclusive behavior and the ethical responsibility of ensuring that the system works inclusively, fostering understanding and respect across diverse populations.. Course: 20CS710 & Project Work. Source: Niral Thiruvizha. Year: 2024-2025.

Title: Dr. A. Jameer Basha. Description: Professor and Head of Computer Science and Engineering He completed his Ph.D. in Faculty of Information and Communication Engineering from Anna University and has been passionate about Information and Communication Engineering since his undergraduate years. Expertise: His research focuses mostly on machine learning, deep learning, and generative AI. His area of expertise is the classification and analysis of medical images. He presented her findings at national and international conferences and published many peer-reviewed pieces in prestigious journals. Research Interests: His current research projects include assessing the vulnerability of endangered species to climate change, modeling the distribution of invasive species in urban areas, and evaluating the effectiveness of community-based conservation.. Qualification: Ph.D in Computer Science and Engineering. Experience: 15+ years of teaching and research experience. Specialization: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning. Email: jameer@hit.edu.in. Phone: +91 9876543210. Achievements: Published 50+ research papers, Recipient of Best Teacher Award 2023.

content.text: Course: 20CS710 & Project Work. Source: Niral Thiruvizha. W P  Attributes: WP2, WP4, WP6. Proposed  E A: EA1, EA3, EA5. P O  Mapped: PO1, PO2, PO4. S D G  Goals: SDG6, SDG11. P S O: PSO2. Justification: WP2 is relevant as the system utilizes data analysis and machine learning algorithms to process real-time data for drainage monitoring and decision-making. WP4 applies because the system integrates IoT and AI technologies, applying engineering principles for smart waste management solutions. WP6 aligns with the real-world application of IoT and AI for waste and drainage management, ensuring the system works effectively in urban environments..

Title: AI Enhanced IoT based Water Management System. Students: AKSHAYA E (720821103009), KAMALESHWARI R (720821103046), KAVIN KUMAR P (720821103053), KAVIYASRI J (720821103054). Summary: An automated surveillance system designed to protect agricultural crops from animal intrusions using Real-time Object Detection (YOLOv8), IoT-based deterrents, and Cloud monitoring to ensure crop safety without manual guarding.. Year: 2024. Type: major.

content.section: Tabs Data - Tabs - Content - Items - Full Details

P S O: PSO2. Justification: An AI-enabled mobile application allows officials to conduct geo-tagged inspections and submit digitally authenticated reports in a secure and efficient manner. Inspection data uploaded to secure cloud storage with dashboards for HOD and District Collectors monitoring. This system ensures genuine, auditable, tamper-proof reports with accurate location and time recording..

Title: Field Visit Tracker: Geo-Tagged Inspections with Digital Signatures. Students: SRIRAM B (720821103106), THIRUKUMARAN RP (720821103114), UDAY RAM S (720821103115). Summary: The Field Visit Tracker is a digital system that modernizes inspections by officials, recording visits with geo-tagging, digital signatures, time, photos, and remarks, storing data in cloud dashboards for monitoring.. Year: 2024. Type: major.
